page.title: 11Ecology and Conservation.
page.content: A number of the farmers are making positive contributions to the protection of the environment. The numerous hedgerows dating from the enclosures of the 16c. act as windbreaks as well as field boundaries Most are trimmed with mechanical cut- ters, but some farmers trim them to a wedge shape to encourage growth at the base, so leaving shelter for wildlife. Also they are allowing trees to grow up in the hedges at intervals to com- pensate for the serious loss of elms from Dutch Elm disease. A tree replacement scheme in co- operation with the farmers has been sponsored by the County Council. Mr. Symington of East Town Farm has creat- ed a small conservation area around a reclaimed pond. Nearby he has planted a copse of mixed trees, some donated by the Council, to serve the ..(pg.12)
